why: GMI reduces pain by retraining the brain's movement maps.

slides.title: Retrain Your Brain
slides.content: Graded Motor Imagery uses mental practice to reduce pain and improve movement

slides.title: Three Stages
slides.content: Progress through left/right discrimination, motor imagery, then mirror therapy

slides.title: Brain Mapping
slides.content: GMI helps normalize your brain's movement maps, reducing protective pain responses

slides.title: Clinical Applications
slides.content: GMI is effective for complex regional pain syndrome, phantom limb pain, and chronic musculoskeletal conditions.

slides.title: Evidence-Based Practice
slides.content: GMI is supported by neuroscience research showing measurable brain changes and pain reduction in clinical trials.

slides.title: Myth vs Fact
slides.content: Myth: Only hard exercise helps pain. Fact: Imagery and mapping can reduce pain too.

slides.title: Try this today
slides.content: 10 left/right recognition taps: is this a left or right hand?
